name: AddTextToMiroBoard
description:
Add a text item to a specified Miro board.

This tool adds a text item to a specified Miro board using the 'boards:write' scope. It's useful when you want to insert text elements into a Miro board for collaboration or documentation purposes. Ensure you have the necessary permissions and adhere to rate limits (Level 2).

parameters.name: board_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Miro board where the text item will be created.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the board where you want to create the item.

parameters.name: text_item_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing data such as content, style, position, geometry, and parent for the text item.

content.description: The actual text (content) that appears in the text item.

data.description: Contains text item data, such as the title, content, or description. For more information on the JSON properties, see [Data](https://developers.miro.com/reference/data).

color.description:
Hex value representing the color for the text within the text item.
Default: `#1a1a1a`.

fillColor.description:
Background color of the text item.
Default: `#ffffff`.

fillOpacity.description:
Opacity level of the background color.
Possible values: any number between `0.0` and `1.0`, where:
`0.0`: the background color is completely transparent or invisible.
`1.0`: the background color is completely opaque or solid.
Default: `1.0` if `fillColor` is provided, `0.0` if `fillColor` is not provided.

fontFamily.description:
Font type for the text in the text item.
Default: `arial`.

textAlign.description:
Horizontal alignment for the item's content.
Default: `center.`

style.description: Contains information about the style of a text item, such as the fill color or font family.

x.description:
X-axis coordinate of the location of the item on the board.
By default, all items have absolute positioning to the board, not the current viewport. Default: `0`.
The center point of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0` coordinates.

y.description:
Y-axis coordinate of the location of the item on the board.
By default, all items have absolute positioning to the board, not the current viewport. Default: `0`.
The center point of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0` coordinates.

position.description: Contains information about the item's position on the board, such as its `x` coordinate, `y` coordinate, and the origin of the `x` and `y` coordinates.

rotation.description: Rotation angle of an item, in degrees, relative to the board. You can rotate items clockwise (right) and counterclockwise (left) by specifying positive and negative values, respectively.

width.description:
Width of the item, in pixels.
The minimum `width` of a `text` widget is relative to the font size of the `text` widget. The width must be at least 1.7 times wider than the font size.
For example, if the font size of the `text` item is `14`, the minimum `width` is `24`.

geometry.description: Contains geometrical information about the item, such as its width or rotation. You can only specify the width of the text item as the height is dynamically updated based on the content.

id.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the parent frame for the item.

parent.description: Contains information about the parent frame for the item.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the miro API.
